text.section:
The governing body of Dorchester County and of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county and municipal corporation property tax imposed on:
property that on July 1, 1969 was owned by the Women's Auxiliary of the Dorchester Memorial Hospital; and
property that is owned by the Cambridge Little League, Incorporated.

The governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:
property that is owned by the Cedar Meadows Rod and Gun Club, Incorporated; and
property that is owned by the Cambridge Skeet and Gun Club, Incorporated.

section.section:
To encourage the location of warehouse plant facilities or the expansion of existing warehouse plant facilities, the governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on the real property of commercial warehouse plant facilities if:
the property is used in connection with warehouse activities; and
the facilities have a minimum of 80,000 square feet of enclosed commercial warehouse space under a roof and within a building or buildings.
A tax credit granted under this subsection may not be granted for more than 20 years.

The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax that is imposed on real property that is:
owned by Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. with the intention of relinquishing ownership in the immediate future;
used exclusively for the purpose of rehabilitation and transfer to a private owner; and
not occupied by administrative or warehouse buildings owned by Habitat for Humanity.

Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc. shall submit an annual written report to the governing body of Dorchester County documenting:
all of Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.'s real property holdings in Dorchester County; and
all transactions involving Habitat for Humanity of Talbot & Dorchester Counties, Inc.'s real property holdings in Dorchester County.

The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may, by law:
set the amount, terms, scope, and duration of a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
adopt any provision necessary to administer a credit granted under paragraph (1) of this subsection.

text.section:
The governing body of Dorchester County or of a municipal corporation in Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that:
is owned by the Chesapeake Audubon Society, Inc.; and
is used solely for:
the environmental education of the public; or
the maintenance of:
a natural area for public use; or
a sanctuary for wildlife.

section.section:
The governing body of Dorchester County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:
agricultural land that is subject to a nutrient management plan or that is developing a nutrient management plan for implementation;
agricultural land that:
is located in an agricultural preservation district; or
is subject to an agricultural land preservation easement or similar easement; or
forest land that is subject to a forest management plan or similar agreement.

In establishing a tax credit under this subsection, the governing body of Dorchester County:
shall develop criteria necessary to implement the credit; and
may specify the amount and duration of the credit, the qualification and application procedures for the credit, and any other requirement or procedure that the governing body considers appropriate.
